channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘I trust that my husband isn’t a gold digger’: I’m inheriting millions of dollars. My husband says I’m ‘selfish’ to keep it. Should I share it?
item.description: “I have been a stay-at-home mom for the past five years and my husband is the sole breadwinner.”

item.title: One House, Three Owners: The Ballooning Cost of the American Dream
item.description: The story of home affordability in the U.S. told from a single front porch.

item.title: My sister made frequent withdrawals from the ‘bank of Mom and Dad.’ Now our family is torn apart. What can I do?
item.description: “My sister did nothing because she was a girl, and my brother was too young to help.”

item.title: Trump Adds Fuel to Claims That Big Banks Discriminate Against Conservatives
item.description: The president has told Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase to stop cutting conservatives off from doing business.

item.title: In China, a Cat-and-Mouse Game to Rein In Crypto
item.description: Recent court cases reveal how middlemen are facilitating a booming trade, eluding a crackdown.

item.title: ‘My retirement is going to be a disaster’: I’m 59 and have $45,000 in my 401(k). I earn $72,000. Am I doomed?
This Financial Coach Is Ready to Fix Your Marriage Too
item.description: Ramit Sethi gets couples to open up for his shows, books, podcasts and a Netflix series.

item.title: Americans Are Carrying Bigger Credit-Card Balances
item.description: Americans are spending more on credit cards and carrying bigger balances month to month, with interest rates hovering near record highs.

item.title: ‘Her crooked son has taken everything’: My fiancé’s 100-year-old aunt was swindled out of $100,000. How can we help?
item.description: “Her son threatened to put her in a nursing home if she didn’t send his check by Friday.”

item.title: ‘I paid for everything from day one’: My husband barely worked during our marriage. Can I leave my $500,000 IRA to my son?
item.description: ‘I do not want my husband to be able to come back to my son and claim the money’
